pageContext.claim: “We have won against ISIS. We've beaten them, and we've beaten them badly. We've taken back the land, and now it's time for our troops to come back home. ... They've killed ISIS, who hurts the world, and we're proud to have done it.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's declaration of victory is premature. There are at least 2,000 -- and possibly as many as 8,000 -- militants holed up along the Euphrates River in eastern Syria. They have they have resisted weeks of attacks by the U.S.-supported forces. Before Trump's announcement that he was pulling U.S. troops out of Syria, senior U.S. officials had insisted U.S. forces would remain for some time because their work was not done.
